intro: Nigella arvensis subsp. divaricata, commonly known as the variable cumin or narrow-leaved weedy cumin, is a flowering plant in the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is native to Europe and parts of western Asia. Its leaves are alternate, lanceolate, and often have a slight pubescence. This subspecies is often found in fields, roadsides, and other open habitats where it can thrive in poor soil conditions.
